item.title: WoW MoP Remix: How to Farm August Celestials Reputation
item.description:
World of Warcraft is one of the best MMOs out there, and recently it has been allowing players on retail to experience nostalgia without having to switch to the Classic servers. The new event, WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria, allows players to dive into Pandaria again.

One important part of the event is ensuring that players are obtaining all the event-exclusive items before time runs out in August. A major way of doing this is by gaining reputation with all the factions in the area . Here's how to farm reputation with the August Celestial faction.

Related
WoW MoP Remix: Fastest Ways To Level

World of Warcraft Remix: Mists of Pandaria is a limited-time event, meaning you'll want to level fast. Here's how to do just that.

Who Are The August Celestials In WoW MoP?

Players who played during the Mists of Pandaria expansion (or who have since gone back to the expansion) will remember the August Celestials. They are the celestial beings, Yulon (the Jade Serpent), Chi-ji (the Red Crane), Xuen (the White Tiger), and Niuzao (the Black Ox). Together, these four beings watch over Pandaria and can be found on the Timeless Isle.

During the original expansion, players couldn't gain reputation with them until they reached level 90 and had gotten to an exalted status with the Golden Locust faction. Thankfully, the remix event doesn't make it this difficult. In fact, players can start gaining reputation relatively quickly and can find the quartermaster for them at the location marked on the map above.

Related
WoW MoP Remix: Every Pet & How to Get Them

WoW's MoP Remix Event adds some new pets to the game. Here's how players can get them.

How To Farm August Celestial Reputation

Finding the August Celestial faction is a little challenging in the event. Players will need to complete daily quests for them in order to start gaining reputation with them. The easiest thing to do is to travel to each of the four temples and check to see if there are any daily quests at those temples.

  • Yulon: The Temple of the Jade Serpent - The Jade Forest
  • Chi-ji: The Temple of the Red Crane - Krasarang Wilds
  • Xuen: The Temple of the White Tiger - Kun-Lai Summit
  • Niuzao: Niuzao Temple - Townlong Steppes
Related
WoW MoP Remix: Raid Entrance Locations & Level Requirements

WoW's Remix MoP event has 5 different raids players can participate in. Here's how to find them all and what level you need to be.

While this certainly isn't a quick endeavor, Blizzard did make it easier for players to gain reputation with the faction during the event than they did during the original expansion. The quickest way to ensure players can achieve exalted status with them is to just keep checking those temples for daily quests. It isn't guaranteed that the faction will have quests at all four temples, but players can still check to be sure. One major reason players want to reach exalted with them is for the Astral Emperorâ€™s Serpent Mount that was added during the event . While the exalted reputation isn't necessary for the mount, it is one of the four requirements that players can meet (they need to meet 2).

item.title: Pokemon GO: Best Moveset For Ferroseed & Ferrothorn
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Ferroseed Moveset In Pokemon GO
  • Best Ferrothorn Moveset In Pokemon GO

In Pokemon GO , many Trainers enjoy not only collecting Pokemon and completing research tasks, but also participating in PvE and PvP battling opportunities such as Raids, Competitive League or seasons, and Gym Battles.

To help gain the upper hand against opponents and increase your rate of victory in Pokemon GO battles, it is important to ensure your team is all equipped with the best moveset. Following May 2024's Ferroseed Incense Day event, many players will be looking to set their Ferroseed and Ferrothorn up for battling, so if they are looking to equip a strong moveset, this guide has all the best options to consider.

Related
Pokemon GO: Mareanie Spotlight Hour Guide

Pokemon GO Trainers who are looking to take part in the Mareanie Spotlight Hour will find all the information they need to prepare in this guide.

Best Ferroseed Moveset In Pokemon GO

Best Overall Ferroseed Moveset

In Pokemon GO , Ferroseed has a maximum CP of 1064 , and a stat spread of 82 ATK, 155 DEF, and 127 STA . Ferroseed is boosted by Snow and Sunny weather and carries a dual type combination of Grass as the primary type, and Steel as the secondary type. Due to this type combination, Ferroseed is weak to Fighting types but has an even more glaring 2x weakness to Fire-type Pokemon and moves . However, Ferrothorn does have resistances to the following types: Water, Steel, Grass, Electric, Dragon, Normal, Poison, Fairy, Rock, and Psychic.

To help work around this huge weakness to Fire types , players will need to determine the best moveset for Ferroseed. In terms of damage output, the best Fast Move and Charged Move combination has been identified below. However, if you need to alter this combination for whatever reason, then some alternative options with similar damage output have also been listed in addition.

  • Fast Move : Metal Claw
  • Charged Move : Iron Head

Secondary Ferroseed Moveset Options

Tackle

Related
Pokemon GO: Everything About Pokemon Fusion

This Pokemon GO guide on Pokemon Fusion details everything you must know before using it.

Best Ferrothorn Moveset In Pokemon GO

As the evolved form of Ferroseed, Ferrothorn shares this same Bug/Steel dual-type combination . Therefore, Ferrothorn is also 1x weak to Fighting type Pokemon, and 2x weak to Fire-type Pokemon. Lastly, Ferrothorn is also resistant to Steel, Water, Electric, Dragon, Grass, Poison, Normal, Rock, Psychic, and Fairy-type moves and Pokemon.

Ferrothorn has a maximum CP of 2624 , and a stat spread of 158 ATK, 223 DEF, and 179 STA . This power of this Pokemon is further boosted by Snow and Sunny weather, and the best moveset combination will enable Ferrothorn to inflict approximately 11.34 damage per second and manage to secure a total damage output of around 363.3 before fainting, as outlined below.

Best Overall Ferroseed Moveset

  • Fast Move : Metal Claw
  • Charged Move : Power Whip

Secondary Ferrothorn Moveset Options

item.title: WoW MoP Remix: Raid Entrance Locations & Level Requirements
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Raids In WoW Remix MoP
  • Why Should You Do Raids In WoW Remix MoP

World of Warcraft is currently hosting an event called WoW Remix: Mists of Pandaria. The event allows players to experience the Mists of Pandaria era in WoW's history while using modern mechanics and ideas, which has excited many fans.

Just like during Mists of Pandaria, players are able to participate in five different raids that are scattered around the lands of Pandaria. These raids are also some of the fastest ways to reach level 70 in the game. Here's a guide to finding all the raid entrances and what level players have to be before taking them on.

Related
WoW MoP Remix: Best Toys

World of Warcraftâ€™s new Mists of Pandaria Remix Event offers a lot of toys for players. Here are the best ones.

All Raids In WoW Remix MoP

There are five different raids that players can take on in the Remix: Mists of Pandaria event. Here are all the raids players can participate in the event.

  • Moguâ€™shan Vaults
  • Heart of Fear
  • Terrace of Endless Spring
  • Throne of Thunder
  • Siege of Orgrimmar

Once players reach level 70, they can unlock Heroic Raids, which are harder versions of each of these raids.

Moguâ€™shan Vaults Location & Required Level

Location: Kun-Lai Summit

Directions: It is located in the northern part near the Temple of the White Tiger. The area is called "Mogu'shan Terrace."

Required Level: 25

Related
WoW MoP Remix: Every Pet & How to Get Them

WoW's MoP Remix Event adds some new pets to the game. Here's how players can get them.

Heart of Fear Location & Required Level

Location: Dread Wastes

Directions: Head to the large tree that is found in the zone on the western side. This raid is located in its base.

Required Level: 35

Terrace of Endless Spring Location & Required Level

Location: The Veiled Stair

Directions: This is in a very small zone located directly between the Vale of Eternal Blossoms and The Jade Forest.

Required Level: 40

Throne of Thunder Location & Required Level

Location: Isle of Thunder

Directions: There is a portal in Townlong Steppes to reach the Isle of Thunder. Speak to the NPC near it, and they will have the player fly to the area and unlock the portal for future use.

Required Level: 50

Siege of Orgrimmar Location & Required Level

Location: Vale of Eternal Blossoms

Directions: It is located in the eastern part of the zone. There are large pillars in front of an area known as "Mogu'shan Palace." The raid is located there.

Required Level: 60

Related
WoW MoP Remix: All Reputations & Quartermaster Locations

Though not all MoP reputation Quartermasters are active, and don't sell goods, they still accept Lucky Charms and offer Daily Quests for rep grinding.

Why Should You Do Raids In WoW Remix MoP

As mentioned above, these raids will help players reach the maximum level faster, and that is the entire point of the event. Players will want to get as much done as possible before it ends so they can receive rewards and items that they otherwise would not be able to obtain. Overall, these raids are worth it for the nostalgia, but they are super helpful in ensuring players reach the max level before the event ends in August.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Sanhua Build Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Best Sanhua Build In Wuthering Waves
  • How To Play Sanhua In Wuthering Waves
  • Sanhua Forte Priority In Wuthering Waves

Sanhua can be an excellent pair with any DPS that depends on their Basic ATK in Wuthering Waves since her Outro Skill grants them a whopping 38% Basic ATK DMG Deepen. This buff can be amazing for some characters like the Havoc Rover in Wuthering Waves .

Other than her Outro Skill, Sanhua doesnâ€™t possess any Supportive Skill at S0. That means her DMG should carry the few seconds sheâ€™s going to spend on the team to build up her Concerto Energy. Therefore, it's crucial to know how to build Sanhua in Wuthering Waves so that players won't lose their precious time.

Related
Wuthering Waves: Current Banner, Next Banner, And Past Banners

Players who wish to know Wuthering Waves' current, next, and past banners can check this article.

Best Sanhua Build In Wuthering Waves

Weapons

Echo Set

Echoes Stats

  1. Emerald of Genesis
  2. Commando of Conviction
  3. Lunar Cutter
  4. Lumingloss
  5. Sword#18
  6. Sword of Night

Main Echo

  • Impermanence Heron
  • Lampylumen Myriad

Echo Sets

  • 5pc Freezing Frost
  • 5pc Moonlit Clouds
  • 5pc Lingering Tunes

  • Cost 4: Crit DMG or Crit Rate
  • Cost 3: Glacio DMG
  • Cost 3: Glacio DMG
  • Cost 1: ATK
  • Cost 1: ATK
  • Sub: Energy Regen, Crit DMG, Crit Rate, or ATK

Best Sanhua Echoes In Wuthering Waves

As a Glacio DPS character in Wuthering Waves , itâ€™s best to build Sanhua with 5pc of Freezing Frost to maximize her Glacio DMG. If Sanhua was operating as a main DPS, then go with Lampylumen Myriad to be her main Echo since it can deal a massive amount of DMG while slightly freezing enemies. If sheâ€™s operating as a Sub-DPS, then casting her Resonance Liberation becomes a priority, which makes Energy a crucial part of her build. To help increase her Energy, prioritize Impermanence Heron, and it will also give Sanhua a slight Supportive buff to her team.

If the game wasnâ€™t kind enough to grant enough Echoes to complete the Freezing Frost set, 5pc of Moonlit Clouds offers a nice amount of Energy Regen for Sub-DPS Sanhua with a nice ATK% buff for the main DPS of her team. On the other hand, 5pc of Lingering Tunes is the best secondary option for her if sheâ€™s the main DPS as it grants her a good amount of ATK%.

Best Sanhua Weapons In Wuthering Waves

Emerald of Genesis is the best weapon for Sanhua in Wuthering Waves . The 5-star Sword raises her Crit Rate, allowing for better Crit management, with a beautiful Energy Recharge and ATK% buffing passive that works nicely with her kit.

Just like most DPS units that depend on ATK% in Wuthering Waves , the best 4-star weapons for Sanhua are Commando of Conviction , Lunar Cutter , and Lumingloss . Theyâ€™re all very close DMG-wise, so if you have any of them, go for it as itâ€™s her second-best option.

Finally, for F2P players, craft the 4-star Sword#18 or Rank 5 the 3-star Sword of Night since they do fine until Sanhua gets better items.

How To Play Sanhua In Wuthering Waves

Thereâ€™s a learning curve to master the art of playing Sanhua in Wuthering Waves . However, once you get used to her combo, she becomes easy to use. Sanhuaâ€™s entire kit can be released within seconds of her joining the battlefield. During that time, she gets to fill out her Concerto and Resonance Energy, which is perfect for any team she joins .

Her gameplay can be split into two parts:

  1. Setting up her Ice
  2. Detonating her Ice with her Heavy ATK

To set up her Ice, trigger her Intro Skill and Sanhua will create Ice Thorn and follow it with her Resonance Liberation to create Glacier. Quickly follow her Ultimate with her Skill and sheâ€™ll create Ice Prism. Now that there are three types of Ice around Sanhua, thereâ€™s a small window to detonate them with her Heavy ATK. Look down at her Forte Gauge as you charge her Heavy ATK and release the button when the cursor is inside the blue area.

Sanhua Forte Priority In Wuthering Waves

Sanhua has some massive scaling on her Talents in Wuthering Waves . Her best Talent is her Resonance Liberation, followed by her Skill and Forte Circuit. As for her Basic ATK and Intro Skill, they can be neglected if sheâ€™s a Sub-DPS.

  1. Resonance Liberation
  2. Resonance Skill
  3. Forte Circuit
  4. Basic ATK
  5. Intro Skill

item.title: Ghost of Tsushima: Where to Find Gold and What It's Used for
item.description:
Updated May 27, 2024, by Christopher Norman Worcester: With the recent release of Ghost of Tsushima on PC, players old and new have been experiencing the incredible journey of Jin Sakai. The surge in popularity has seen players looking for help with many of the game's trickiest items and resources. This update will add a video that explains how players can find Gold in Ghost of Tsushima, and what to do with it once they do.

In Ghost of Tsushima, players will have to collect materials from all over the map in order to complete quests, craft, and upgrade Jin Sakai's armor. One of the many items that players can collect is gold, and it serves a very important purpose.

Related
Ghost of Tsushima: Do Charms Stack?

Ghost of Tsushima allows players to gather duplicate charms that can be equipped simultaneously. Here's how they work.

Gold in Ghost of Tsushima

New players have flocked to this year-old title now that many PlayStation fans are finally getting their hands on next-generation consoles and upgrading their copy of Ghost of Tsushima from PS4 to PS5 . And a few of those who have been playing this Sucker Punch title may be wondering just how to upgrade their katana: the answer is gold .

Gold's only use in Ghost of Tsushima is to upgrade Jin's sword . Starting at Rank IV, players can use gold to make the katana stronger at any of the Swordsmiths in the game. Although the Sakai Tanto, a smaller blade that Jin also uses, has gold in the description, this rare material is not needed to upgrade it. It does use the same sword kit as the katana, however. Since players will want a strong, upgraded weapon for their Ghost, they will need to find gold as quickly as possible and in large quantities.

How to Find Gold in Ghost of Tsushima

Gold is only used for one purpose in Ghost of Tsushima , and there is only one way to get it: freeing enemy-held territories by partaking in bloody Mongol and Samurai battles . But unfortunately, only the larger pieces of land give out gold when cleared completely of Mongol influence. The sections of the map that give out gold when liberated are:

  • Izuhara's Ogawa Dojo
  • Izuhara's Mongol Shipyard
  • Izuhara's Logging Base
  • Izuhara's Logging Camp
  • Toyotama's Kishibe Village
  • Toyotama's Fort Imai
  • Toyotama's Numata Settlement
  • Kamiagata's General Dogshin's Camp
  • Kamiagata's General Bartu's Camp

Each Ghost of Tsushima map section that is cleared will earn players 2 gold. This means that players will need to clear quite a bit before getting into the upper levels of the sword's potential strength. In order to upgrade, players will need:

How to Use Gold in Ghost of Tsushima

As previously mentioned, the only use for gold in GoT is upgrading the Sakai katana. There are several upgrade levels, but gold is not required until the player reaches level 4. The requirements for upgrading the katana are as follows:

Sakai Katana Upgrade Requirements:

Upgrade Level

Upgrade Requirements

2

  • Supplies x150
  • Iron x10

3

  • Supplies x300
  • Iron x25
  • Steel x5

4

  • Supplies x450
  • Iron x40
  • Steel x10
  • Gold x1

5

  • Supplies x600
  • Iron x65
  • Steel x20
  • Gold x2

6

  • Supplies x750
  • Iron x80
  • Steel x40
  • Gold x4

7

  • Supplies x1000
  • Iron x100
  • Steel x80
  • Gold x6

8 (New Game Plus)

  • Supplies x1200
  • Iron x120
  • Steel x90
  • Gold x8

For those who are quick at adding up numbers, they'll easily note that 21 pieces of gold are needed to get to level 8, while players can only earn up to 18 pieces. Level 8 katanas are not available during the first playthrough; players will have to start a New Game + in order to get to the eighth and final upgrade.
